citations.narrative:
The acquisition and disposition records available for review are not current or complete. The inventory list is missing some
of the animals exhibited (Asiatic water buffalo, bison, cattle, goats, sheep, swans, emu, and geese). Only the eland and
two camels have complete acquisition and disposition records. The other animal inventory is either missing all or part of
the following: dates of acquisition or disposition, names and addresses of whom the animals were acquired from or given
to, and/or their USDA license number or Driver’s license number.
Without records which fully disclose the animal’s acquisition as well as disposition information, legal and medical
information traceback is not possible. The facility shall ensure that it makes, keeps, and maintains records which fully and
correctly disclose the following information concerning all exhibition animals: name, address, and USDA number, if
applicable, of the person from whom the animal was acquired from or given to, the date of the acquisition or disposition,
the species and quantity of animals involved. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her
possession or under his or her control.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by OCTOBER 12, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The acquisition and disposition records available for review are not current or complete. The inventory list is missing some 
of the animals exhibited (Asiatic water buffalo, bison, cattle, goats, sheep, swans, emu, and geese). Only the eland and 
two camels have complete acquisition and disposition records. The other animal inventory is either missing all or part of 
the following: dates of acquisition or disposition, names and addresses of whom the animals were acquired from or given 
to, and/or their USDA license number or Driver’s license number.  
 
Without records which fully disclose the animal’s acquisition as well as disposition information, legal and medical 
information traceback is not possible. The facility shall ensure that it makes, keeps, and maintains records which fully and 
correctly disclose the following information concerning all exhibition animals: name, address, and USDA number, if 
applicable, of the person from whom the animal was acquired from or given to, the date of the acquisition or disposition, 
the species and quantity of animals involved. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her 
possession or under his or her control. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by OCTOBER 12, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License 
Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
